Authors: Novianti E., Dennis, Valentinus, Oktaviandrie Y.F., Richard M., Hutagaol B.J., Fajar A.N., Retnowardhani A.
Title: SOA System for Commerce Transaction in Indonesia: I-HEMAT
Source title: Proceedings of the International Conference on Electrical Engineering and Informatics
Affiliations: Faculty of Engineering, Darma Persada University, Information System Department, Radin Inten II Street, Jakarta, Indonesia; BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia

Abstract: Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) is a paradigm for organizing and utilizing distributed capabilities, SOA has been adapted as information technology to help selling and shopping activity in separate platform and complicated activity become one place. Customer in Indonesia looking for a best quality product with a lowest price, so we proposed SOA to build a website with a concept one stop shopping for people in Indonesia. It's helps customer to find a product, compare the product, searching for a promotion and also view the review from other people from social media and other platform. And it's help seller to promote their product, so their promotion can reach target customer. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: E-Commerce Transaction; ESB; Service Oriented Architecture (SOA)
Index Keywords: Information services; Sales; Indonesia; Lowest price; One stop; Quality product; Shopping activity; Social media; Service oriented architecture (SOA)
